text: I'm Seth kugel the frugal traveler for
the New York Tops
this summer I traveled from Brazil to
New York City in 13 weeks the final leg
took me from Mexico into Texas and
across the American South what better
way to get reacquainted with my country
than to see it by train forget about the
beautiful scenery outside the real
attraction was in some meeting my fellow
passengers and it was surprisingly cheap
as well there were Japanese tourists big
southern families and even moms back
when my girls were 4 and 10 in the days
of jogging suits we put on our jogging
suits when we got on the train in in San
Francisco area and and took the train up
to Seattle Washington we woke up in the
morning and one daughter was curled up
across the aisle with a like a Japanese
foreign exchange student and the other
daughter had found this older Widow
gentleman and had used his shoulder and
it was great they we still talked about
it it was a memory I find the experience
of the training meet a lot of people
from different countries and different
states
and the staff feature very nice
do they train you to be nice to those
higher nice people
well let's do that you can whew if
you're not nice they don't want you
working here
you really have to use
since my toes into it the train is so
comfortable that you almost forget the
point is to get off my first stop was
Lafayette Louisiana Cajun country where
I took a swamp tour went to a duck
festival and learned how peppers are
chosen for Tabasco they have to compare
the different shades of red to this I
also made a stop in New Orleans for
music in high school
back on the train again I saw some real
family bonding
my name is Roger no you know and I'm
from arendelle and I can't I came on the
trying because I wanted to go to New
Orleans
an adventure for some and we found
we do something different from with a
strange it was that is the perfect thing
the families got off in Birmingham and
so did I
I took a walk through civil rights
history visiting what was the official
black business district during Jim Crow
days and even attended a live concert by
the temptation sorta but they were a
little bit stiff compared to my fellow
travelers this is a beautiful country
just to look at the mountains and the
desert and the plains and the cities I
don't think you can put a price on that
but you have to get off the train to see
a place like Savannah Georgia with its
gracious old squares and supposedly
scary ghosts to it
Jim pulls out his own gun and he fires
three shots in the Danny and Danny dies
right there on the floor of the study a
final night's ride brought my train trip
to a close in Washington DC versus
another coach where my brother and his
family welcomed I wouldn't be in New
York for another day but after 13 weeks
on the road and 34 hotel rooms it sure
felt like home
